title: Religion in flux: Islam surges, Christianity shrinks; Hinduism holds steady
content: A recent Pew Research Center report reveals that while most major religious groups expanded between 2010 and 2020, Christianity's global share declined due to religious switching, despite a population increase. Islam experienced the fastest growth, driven by demographics and higher fertility rates. The religiously unaffiliated saw a significant rise, largely due to individuals leaving Christianity.

title: Fresh caste survey in Karnataka; CM Siddaramaiah sets 90-day deadline
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced a fresh caste survey following concerns from various stakeholders regarding the 2015-16 report. The Congress high command advised considering all perspectives on the survey. The new enumeration aims to address apprehensions and will be completed within 90 days, potentially impacting reservation policies for Backward Communities.

title: 'We want to give them a send-off': Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma possibly playing their final series
content: Indian cricket icons Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to feature in Australia's upcoming ODI series, potentially their last on Australian soil, according to Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg. He highlighted a packed summer schedule, including matches in every Australian capital.

title: Austria school shooting: Assailant used two weapons; what we know about attacker
content: A devastating shooting at a high school in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of ten people, including seven students and the suspected attacker. The incident prompted a swift response from special forces and the evacuation of the school. Authorities believe the student assailant acted alone and likely took his own life after opening fire, leaving several others seriously injured.

title: Murder in hills of Meghalaya: The masterminds and three accused
content: A honeymoon trip turned deadly in Meghalaya as Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered. His newlywed wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, are accused of orchestrating the crime. Police have arrested five individuals, including Sonam and Raj, in connection with the murder, revealing a shocking conspiracy and a multi-state manhunt.

title: ChatGPT down: OpenAI's AI chatbot experiences global outage; Company says ...
content: ChatGPT, the popular AI chatbot by OpenAI, faced a major global disruption. Users across India, the US, and the UK reported issues with the web, app, login, and APIs. OpenAI acknowledged the problem, citing elevated error rates and latency. Services like APIs, ChatGPT, and Sora were affected. The company is investigating the cause of the degraded performance.

title: LA riots: Masked looters ransack Apple store, flee with merchandise - Video
content: Los Angeles is facing unrest as protests intensify against President Trump's immigration raids, leading to looting, including an Apple store incident. Trump has deployed National Guard troops and is escalating military presence, a move opposed by local officials and Governor Newsom. The protests were triggered by increased federal immigration enforcement, resulting in arrests and escalating tensions between the federal government and California leadership.

title: Gold vs Silver: Why silver may outperform gold; record-breaking rally likely
content: Silver prices have surged, hitting a 13-year high, fueled by a weakening dollar. Technical indicators suggest a potential breakout, with historical data showing strong returns after reaching new highs.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: When Nietzsche met God in the tunnels of Gaza
content: Omer had never been strictly religious. Like many secular Israelis, faith was a distant concept. He had completed his military service and was waiting tables to save for a post-army trip to South America. Yet, within days of his abduction, he began talking to God, making promises, and blessing the scraps of food he was given. It was faith, he would later recall, that kept him anchored—a source of strength in a reality with no clocks, no sunlight, and no certainty of survival.

title: 'No details about incident ': MEA raises Indian student handcuff incident with US
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has taken up the detention of an Indian student in the US with the US embassy, according to sources. This follows an incident at Newark Airport where another Indian student was allegedly handcuffed and deported. The Indian Embassy in Washington DC and the Consulate in New York are seeking details.

title: LA riots: Trump gives 'if I didn't' justification on sending troops
content: Donald Trump claimed his decision to deploy troops in Los Angeles prevented chaos. He criticised California's leadership and permitting delays. Protests erupted over deportation policies. National Guard and Marines were deployed. State officials opposed federal intervention. A lawsuit was filed against the Trump administration. Mayor Karen Bass expressed confusion over the Marines' deployment. Protests continue in other cities as well.

title: Steve Jobs told Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay married to .., skill he says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: 'A very good conversation': Shashi Tharoor on delegation meet with US VP Vance
content: Shashi Tharoor reported on the Indian delegation's "remarkable" meeting with US Vice President JD Vance, strategically positioned between Vance's calls with the Chinese President and German Chancellor. The delegation conveyed concerns and objectives related to India's counter-terrorism stance, receiving positive feedback.

title: Taylor Swift 'feels trapped' in NFL world: Insider says she’s overwhelmed
content: Insiders reveal that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's romance is facing strain as Kelce's rigorous NFL training clashes with Swift's glamorous lifestyle. Kelce's focus on strict fitness and early nights contrasts with Swift's fast-paced routine, leading to tension. While Swift remains supportive, she misses the spontaneity and fun they once shared as they navigate their demanding careers.

title: 'No travel demand': Airlines ask govt to waive user charges at Srinagar airport
content: Following a significant drop in tourism after the Pahalgam attack, airlines are urging the government to waive airport and security fees for Srinagar flights for a year. This request aims to financially incentivize travel and revive visitor numbers to Kashmir, where hotels and flights are experiencing drastically reduced demand and prices.

title: 'Until we got married': Kansas City Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes opens up about wife
content: Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback Patrick Mahomes recently lauded his wife, Brittany, for her unwavering support since their high school days. He credited her for helping him evolve, both on and off the field. Mahomes highlighted Brittany's constant presence and influence, acknowledging her pivotal role in his personal and professional growth.

title: Austria school shooting: Video shows panic, fear as gunshots echo; 10 killed
content: A tragic school shooting in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of 10 individuals, including the student perpetrator. Authorities suspect the gunman took his own life after the attack at BORG Dreierschützengasse school. A disturbing video capturing the sounds of gunfire has surfaced, prompting widespread shock and grief across Europe, with officials expressing condolences and emphasizing the need for school safety.

title: Gauri Khan rents apartment for staff, Sunita Ahuja on reason for fights with Govinda
content: Gauri Khan rents a Mumbai apartment for her staff during Mannat's renovation, while Karan Johar praises the grounded nature of Aryan and Suhana Khan. Sunita Ahuja reveals disagreements with Govinda stem from his career choices. Varun Grover accuses Sandeep Reddy Vanga of obnoxious behavior, and Deepika Padukone launches 75 badminton centers to honor her father's 70th birthday.

title: 'We will go deep into Pak': Jaishankar’s stern message over terror
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar issued a strong warning to Pakistan, stating India's readiness to conduct strikes within Pakistani territory in response to terrorist provocations. This declaration follows recent Indian military actions, including 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terror camps after a deadly attack in Pahalgam.

title: Woman in black: How elusive Sonam resurfaced in Ghazipur after 16 days
content: Sahil Yadav helped Sonam Raghuvansi, who was distressed, at his dhaba. Sonam had gone missing from Meghalaya. She made a call to her brother. Sahil then called the police. Indore police alerted Ghazipur police. Sonam was taken to a One Stop Center. She was exhausted and slept. Police await Meghalaya team to record her statement.

title: 'Didn't kill my husband': What Sonam told UP cops, what she didn't
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing for over two weeks, was found at a UP dhaba and arrested in connection with her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon. Police allege she plotted the crime with lover Raj Kushwaha. While Sonam denies killing Raja, her silence on key details and missing jewellery deepen suspicion. Both families have demanded a CBI probe.

title: 'Result of Centre's callousness': Mamata blames govt for Pahalgam attack
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticized the Union government's "callousness" regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing the BJP of politicizing the armed forces' valor. She questioned the absence of security personnel at the attack site while praising the forces' bravery during Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Farhan Akhtar got Rs 45 lakh for saying jokes written by me': Varun Grover
content: Varun Grover, the multifaceted screenwriter and comedian, recounted his early career experience on 'Oye! It's Friday!' hosted by Farhan Akhtar, where he noticed a stark pay disparity between writers and actors. Despite writing the material, Grover earned significantly less than Akhtar, leading him to question the value attributed to performers versus writers.

title: At least 10 dead in Austria school shooting, suspect kills self
content: A school shooting in Graz, Austria, at the BORG Dreierschützengasse school has resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries. The suspected shooter, believed to be a student, reportedly died by suicide in a school toilet. Police responded swiftly to the scene, with special forces and emergency units deployed, and are currently investigating the incident.

title: Why Forsyth might have been the greatest spy thriller writer of all time
content: The top spot, without contest, belongs to a former Royal Air Force pilot with an eye for detail and a knack for turning geopolitical chaos into page-turning precision: Frederick Forsyth, who departed for Elysium on June 9.

title: 'Eat, sleep, breathe badminton': Deepika's tribute to dad Prakash
content: Deepika Padukone celebrated her father, Prakash Padukone's 70th birthday, by announcing a significant expansion of the Padukone School of Badminton (PSB). The initiative has established over 75 coaching centers across 18 Indian cities, aiming to make badminton accessible to all. ​​​Ranveer Singh, reacting to the announcement, dropped a heart emoji in the comments section.

title: 'Dhoni bhai ... ': Raina's touching words sends fans into nostalgia
content: Suresh Raina celebrated MS Dhoni's induction into the ICC Hall of Fame, acknowledging his significant impact on cricket. Raina highlighted Dhoni's calm leadership, game-changing contributions, and unwavering commitment as inspirations for millions. Dhoni, now the 11th Indian in the Hall of Fame, is celebrated for his unparalleled leadership and remarkable achievements with the bat and behind the stumps.

title: 'Terrific coach': NFL legend Tom Brady supports Mike Vrabel to lead the Patriots
content: Tom Brady endorses Mike Vrabel as the Patriots' new head coach, citing his leadership and toughness. Vrabel, who replaces Bill Belichick after a transitional season, brings a no-nonsense approach and a proven track record from his time with the Titans. Brady's support fuels hope for a Patriots turnaround, emphasizing Vrabel's ability to instill discipline and resilience.

title: Tragedy strikes Jaipur picnic group: 8 drown in Banas river
content: Eight men from Jaipur drowned in the Banas river in Rajasthan’s Tonk district on Tuesday. The victims, aged 25-30, were bathing when they accidentally ventured into deep water. Police rescued three survivors who are now stable, but eight were declared dead at the hospital. Authorities are investigating how the group slipped into the deeper part of the river.

title: 'On flight to Sweden': Israel deports Greta after intercepting Gaza-bound ship
content: Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel after being intercepted on a Gaza-bound aid ship. Israeli forces seized the vessel, prompting condemnation from rights groups who cited international law violations. Israel defended its actions, asserting its right to enforce the naval blockade of Gaza, while dismissing the aid mission as a publicity stunt. Former President Trump mocked Thunberg's involvement.

title: 'Peace claims absurd': Cong slams Amit Shah; says BJP diverting attention
content: The Congress party criticizes Amit Shah's claims about peace in Jammu and Kashmir and the Northeast. Jairam Ramesh alleges Shah is diverting attention from failures. He mentions unpunished terrorists in Pahalgam and a poor law and order situation in Manipur. Ramesh accuses Shah of boasting with minimal achievements. Shah had highlighted national security improvements under the Modi government.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' first review: Sudha Murty calls film an 'eye opener'
content: Aamir Khan is returning to the screen with 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The film is a remake of 'Champions'. Sudha Murty praised the movie after a special screening. She highlighted its sensitive portrayal of children with special needs. Murty believes the film promotes inclusivity. 'Sitaare Zameen Par' received a standing ovation. The movie also stars Genelia D'souza.

title: Who is Aleksander Barkov’s GF? Exploring Florida Panthers star player’s life
content: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov is currently dating tennis star Marie Bouzkova. The couple made their relationship public in 2024 but maintain a private life. Barkov was seen supporting Bouzkova at Wimbledon. Bouzkova, a Czech tennis player, achieved her first singles title in 2022 at the Prague Open. She holds impressive singles and doubles rankings.

title: 'Will not tolerate illegal entry': US embassy amid Indian student handcuffing row
content: The US embassy in India has firmly stated its stance against illegal immigration, emphasizing that visa abuse and violation of US laws will not be tolerated. This announcement follows an incident at Newark Airport where an Indian student was allegedly handcuffed and deported, sparking outrage.

title: 'Operating with force': Israel issues evacuation warning for parts of Gaza
content: Amid escalating tensions, the Israeli army issued evacuation warnings for northern Gaza areas following a projectile interception. The military declared it would forcefully respond to any terrorist act, urging immediate evacuation south to Gaza City shelters.

title: Did Musk use ketamine, ecstasy drugs? What Trump said
content: Despite a recent public falling out with Elon Musk over tax and spending policies, President Trump stated he intends to continue using Starlink at the White House, praising it as a "good service." This decision comes after Trump hinted at potentially disposing of his Tesla, purchased earlier this year.

title: Delhi police remove former CM Atishi from protest spot, detained
content: AAP leader Atishi was detained by Delhi Police during a protest against planned demolitions at Kalkaji's Bhoomiheen Camp, where residents face eviction notices from the DDA. Atishi accused the BJP of deploying excessive security forces and bulldozing the settlement, primarily inhabited by migrant laborers, despite previous demolitions.

title: Bid to revive J&K tourism: BJP leader plays cricket in Pahalgam; watch video
content: Ravinder Raina, a BJP leader, played cricket with locals in Pahalgam. This was an effort to bring normalcy back to the valley. Tourism declined after the April 22 terrorist attack. Travel agents will meet in Srinagar and Pahalgam to boost tourism. Security measures are in place for the upcoming Amarnath Yatra.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla to take tardigrades to ISS: What are these ‘water bears’
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will conduct the Voyager Tardigrades mission on the ISS, studying how these resilient micro-animals survive and reproduce in space. Scientists aim to unlock the secrets of tardigrades' extreme survival to revolutionize space medicine and develop protective measures for astronauts during long-duration missions. This experiment could lead to advancements in genetics, biomaterials, and cryopreservation.

title: 'Promises kept': Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill' ends Medicaid for illegal immigrants
content: President Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill" aims to end taxpayer-funded healthcare for undocumented immigrants, sparking controversy amid immigration tensions in Los Angeles. The bill proposes increased ICE agents, deportation targets, and enforcement bonuses. While positioned as fulfilling Trump's promises, it faces criticism, including from Elon Musk, over its projected $3 trillion contribution to the national debt.

title: 'Enough is enough': Former Israel PM blames Netanyahu for Gaza war
content: Former Israeli prime minister Ehud Olmert accuses Benjamin Netanyahu of failing to prevent the October 7th attacks and urges Donald Trump to intervene, emphasizing US influence. Olmert proposes a two-state solution with land swaps to resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, highlighting the need for new leadership on both sides to achieve lasting peace.

title: Dwarka fire: Man, 2 kids die after jumping from 8th floor to escape blaze
content: A tragic fire occurred at Shabad Society in Dwarka Sector 13. A 10-year-old boy and his sister died after jumping from their balcony. Their father, Yash Yadav, also died after jumping. His wife and elder son are receiving treatment. The fire started on the eighth and ninth floors. Firefighters evacuated all other residents. Authorities are assessing the building's structural integrity.

title: ‘Prompt & professional’: China thanks India for rescue of ship off Kerala coast
content: Following a massive fire on the Singapore-flagged MV Wan Hai 503 off the Kerala coast, China has expressed gratitude to India for its swift response in rescuing crew members, including Chinese nationals. The Indian Coast Guard deployed ships and aircraft for firefighting and rescue operations after the explosion on June 9.

title: Sitting on cash? Use it to prepay your home loan after RBI repo rate cut; how you will benefit
content: Even though home loan rates are expected to come down, prepayment will save you more than what you earn from fixed income options. High-cost and long-term loans should be retired as early as possible.

title: Ruturaj Gaikwad to play for Sachin Tendulkar's former team in England
content: Yorkshire County Cricket Club has announced the signing of Indian batter Ruturaj Gaikwad for the remainder of the English domestic season. The 28-year-old, who has represented India in both ODIs and T20s, will join the team in July for the County Championship game against Surrey and will also be available for the Metro Bank One Day Cup.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: Still-too-early MLB All-Stars: Roster predictions, biggest debates
content: Freddie Freeman vs. Pete Alonso? Tarik Skubal vs. Kris Bubic? Here's our look at who will make it to Atlanta.

title: Sources: Watt not attending Steelers minicamp
content: Steelers star pass rusher T.J. Watt is not attending this week's mandatory minicamp amid his pursuit of a new contract, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Buffs' Sanders dealing with health issue
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders has been ill and away from the team recently, a source confirmed to ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Panthers dominate in rout to seize 2-1 series lead
content: The Panthers seized control of what had been a tight Stanley Cup Final after two games, dominating the discombobulated Oilers 6-1 in Game 3.

title: Sources: Commanders' McLaurin skips minicamp
content: Commanders receiver Terry McLaurin, who is seeking a contract extension, did not report to Washington's mandatory minicamp Tuesday, sources told ESPN.

title: Oilers unravel as 'penalty chaos' reigns in Game 3
content: In a blowout Game 3 loss, the Oilers took 21 penalties for 85 penalty minutes, pulled their starting goaltender, had a near line-brawl, and one of their players was irritated enough to squirt a stream from his water bottle at the Florida bench.

title: Study: Less online abuse of NCAA tourney players
content: Although social media abuse of athletes dropped during March Madness, a study showed Tuesday, harassment of tournament officials and coaches spiked.

title: Sources: Hendrickson skips Bengals minicamp
content: Bengals star DE Trey Hendrickson will not report for mandatory minicamp, which starts Tuesday, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, as Hendrickson seeks a long-term deal.

title: Pulisic likes dad's response to Donovan criticism
content: Christian Pulisic's dad, Mark, hit back at Landon Donovan on Monday after the U.S. soccer great appeared to criticize the midfielder for his decision to sit out the upcoming Gold Cup to rest after wrapping up his season with AC Milan.

title: 🏀 NBA mock draft: Debating 30 Round 1 picks
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: What do we really know about Michael Penix Jr.? Answering one big question for seven QBs entering Year 2
content: We answered key questions about quarterbacks from the 2024 draft class, including Michael Penix Jr., Caleb Williams and Jayden Daniels.

title: From Kick-Six to the Lamar Leap: The top 25 college football plays of the millennium
content: Ahead of the 2025 season, our writers voted on the most significant and wildest plays of the past 25 years.

title: 'It's not a fair fight': Looking back at Tiger's historic 2000 U.S. Open championship
content: Woods arrived at Pebble Beach playing great golf and proceeded to lap the field, winning by 15 strokes. We look back at some of the highlights from one of the most dominant major performances in history.

title: Who is Ellie the Elephant? A day with the New York Liberty icon
content: The Liberty's mascot elevates fandom in the WNBA. Trailing her was like hanging with the Beatles or Beyoncé

title: Parenting and game plans: Inside Jenny Boucek's extraordinary basketball journey to the Pacers
content: For decades, Boucek had professional dreams and personal ones -- and believed they were mutually exclusive. Now, as a mom and the first front-of-the-bench female assistant in the NBA, she's finally living both.

title: Panthers clobber Oilers: Grades, key players, big questions for both teams
content: The score was 6-1, and Florida was in control from the start. Here's how it all happened, and what comes next.

title: Is Mauricio Pochettino's style too slow for the USMNT?
content: This U.S. team is filled with pace, though Mauricio Pochettino is all about slow, deliberate play. It presents an obvious challenge: Can the USMNT get up to speed before the World Cup?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Storm bounce back while Sky fall in Week 4 edition
content: Seattle returns to the top three while Chicago tumbles as the middle of the league finds its footing.

title: What we’ve learned through two games of the NBA Finals
content: The Thunder evened the series on Sunday with a win over the Pacers. Here's what to watch heading into Game 3.

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Who won the men's transfer portal? Let's rank the 13 best teams
content: These teams got the best players from the transfer portal -- with some familiar faces in the mix for top spot.

title: Yamal has the mentality of Messi, Ronaldo. He'll be even better in 2025-26
content: Lamine Yamal may have fallen short in the Champions League and Nations League, but that will only motivate the Barcelona and Spain star to get better.

title: Transfer trends: Portugal-to-Prem pipeline, Italy is Europe's retirement home
content: Diving into 2,000 transfers, ESPN's Bill Connelly identifies the good, the bad and the ugly market trends since 2015.

title: LaLiga chief Tebas: Club World Cup 'absurd'
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas reiterated in an interview Monday that he considers the upcoming FIFA Club World Cup "completely absurd."

title: Sources: Utd focus on Mbeumo, eye Gyökeres
content: Man United are prioritising signing Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo before focusing on a potential move for Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Miami owner Mas wants Messi to retire with club
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas told ESPN Monday that negotiations with Lionel Messi over a new contract remain ongoing, but said he's optimistic the team captain will be with the club to inaugurate its new stadium Miami Freedom Park in March 2026.

title: Utd woes to Brazil call-up: Antony hit 'rock bottom'
content: Antony has described his return to the national team as more emotional than his first Brazil call-up after "hitting rock bottom" at Manchester United earlier this season.

title: Madrid's Huijsen didn't want 'any other team'
content: Dean Huijsen said he wanted to be at Real Madrid "from day one" as he was presented as the club's first summer signing on Tuesday.

title: Dortmund sign Jobe Bellingham 5 years after Jude
content: Borussia Dortmund have signed Sunderland midfielder Jobe Bellingham, five years after signing his brother Jude, the club have announced.

title: Divisional rankings: Nakatani, Opetaia win by KO, top their divisions
content: Junto Nakatani and Jai Opetaia won again, while Abdullah mason got closer to the top 10 at lightweight. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: UFC 316 clears the way for much-anticipated bantamweight showdowns
content: Two blockbuster fights seem imminent for the UFC 316 main card winners, while next steps for the losers are murkier.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Sam Bennett gains ground in Conn Smythe odds
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
content: Sinner and Alcaraz have combined to win the last six Grand Slams -- and are pushing each other to new heights in the sport.

title: Waiver wire: A pair of Blue Jays deserve your attention
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Kate Martin has arrived, Odyssey Sims thriving
content: Kate Martin has become a key scoring specialist for the Valkyries that could prove rewarding in fantasy while Odyssey Sims continues to break out in Los Angeles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gyökeres angry at Sporting's transfer fee demand
content: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres fears he is being priced out of a move to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: PM Meets Members Of All-Party Delegations For Anti-Terror Outreach Effort
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday evening met members of multi-party delegations who had travelled to world capitals to convey India's strong stand against Pakistan-linked terrorism following Operation Sindoor.

title: BJP vs Trinamool After Bengal Assembly Avoids 'Op Sindoor' In Resolution
content: The West Bengal Assembly on Tuesday unanimously adopted a resolution commending the Indian armed forces for their precision strikes on terror hubs across the western border, even as the proceedings were marred by a stormy political

title: Trainer Plane Makes Emergency Landing At Madhya Pradesh Airport, Pilots Safe
content: A trainer plane belonging to a private flying academy made an emergency landing at Khajuraho airport on Tuesday after its right rear wheel (landing gear) didn't open, an official said.

title: Uber To Launch Self-Driving Taxis In London Next Year
content: Ride-hailing firm Uber will launch self-driving taxis in London next year when England trials new driverless services, the firm and the UK government said on Tuesday.

title: "Like Cat Guarding Milk": India Criticises UN Over Pak's Anti-Terror Panel Role
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said today that in recent years, many decisions of the United Nations have been questioned.

title: 5 Qatar-Based Indians Die In Kenya Bus Accident. They Were On A Holiday
content: At least five Indian nationals, residing in Qatar, were killed after their bus met with an accident in Kenya, where they were on a holiday, the Embassy of India in Doha said on Tuesday.

title: "Did You Eat Anything?" Last Phone Call Between Raja Raghuvanshi, His Mother
content: These are some of the pressing questions that Raja Raghuvanshi's mother put to him in a call on May 23, in what turned out to be her last call to her son.

title: Key NSG Counter-Terror Event Begins, Focus On Unified Response
content: In the wake of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam and India's response in the form of Operation Sindoor, the 23rd edition of the National Security Guard's (NSG) Counter-Terror International Seminar commenced in New Delhi on Tuesday.

title: "Deranged, Dangerous": California Governor Shreds Trump Over Military Move
content: To put an end to the protests, about 700 Marines have been deployed in Los Angeles and 4,000 National Guard troops have been mobilised. Notably, the American military does not have any domestic law enforcement role.

title: US Agencies Tracked Foreigners Visiting Musk's Properties In 2022, 2023: Report
content: US government agencies tracked foreign nationals' visits to Elon Musk's properties amid concerns over possible attempts to influence the tech billionaire, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Delhi Sizzles At 43.8 Degrees Celsius, Records Season's Hottest Day
content: In the grip of extreme heat, Delhi on Tuesday recorded its highest maximum temperature of the season at 43.8 degrees Celsius, 3.6 notches above the season's average, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: Delhi Man, His 2 Children Jump Off Building To Escape Fire, Die
content: A fire broke out on the eighth and ninth floors of a high-rise in Delhi's Dwarka, with smoke and fire engulfing a house.

title: Weather, Rocket Issues May Further Delay India's Cosmic Leap
content: All eyes will be in the sky tomorrow as the rocket carrying Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, and a billion Indian hopes, lifts off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Wednesday. Group Captain Shukla will be only the second Indian in space.

title: "In Touch With Authorities": India On Man Being Pinned Down At US Airport
content: The government has reacted strongly to a social media post claiming that an Indian national has been detained at Newark Airport in New Jersey, formally raising the matter with the US Embassy in New Delhi, top sources revealed on Tuesday.

title: "Operation Sindoor Biggest Action Against Terror In Indian History": Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said the Pahalgam terror strike was not just an attack on our people but also an assault on the social unity of India, as he asserted that Operation Sindoor carried out in retaliation was the "biggest action" against terror.

title: Was Kidnapped By Israeli Troops In International Waters: Greta Thunberg
content: Swedish activist Greta Thunberg said on Tuesday she was kidnapped in international waters by Israeli forces as she arrived in Paris Charles de Gaulle airport after being deported from Israel.

title: Democracy Goes Digital: Survey On Modi Government's 11 Years Gets 5 Lakh Responses In A Day
content: Marking Prime Minister Narendra Modi's completion of 11 years in office, the NaMo app has launched the Jan Man Survey, an interactive platform enabling citizens to directly contribute to national discourse.

title: Trump Says Los Angeles 'Would Burn To The Ground' If He Did Not Send Troops
content: To put an end to the protests, about 700 Marines have been deployed in Los Angeles and 4,000 National Guard troops have been mobilised. Notably, the American military does not have any domestic law enforcement role.

title: "Never Thought NCP Would Split": Sharad Pawar At Foundation Day Event
content: NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar on Tuesday said they never thought the Nationalist Congress Party, co-founded by him 26 years ago, would suffer a split and appreciated workers of his outfit for taking it ahead despite challenges.

title: "Incomprehensible": Turkmenistan Expresses Concern Over Trump's Travel Ban
content: Turkmenistan said Tuesday it was "concerned" after the Central Asian state, one of the most closed in the world, was targeted by US President Donald Trump's travel ban it called "incomprehensible".

title: In shipwreck, best practice is to register case against ship owner, says ex-Shipping Secretary
content: He says the case can be pursued both legally and through negotiations, citing an incident involving MSC in Maharashtra

title: PM Modi meets members of all-party delegations
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar meets delegations to convey India’s strong stand against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism, promoting national unity globally

title: At least five Qatar-based Indian nationals die in road accident in Kenya
content: The identity of the dead is yet to be verified, while 27 are injured and admitted to various hospitals in Kenya

title: Spike in leptospirosis cases worries Health department in Kerala
content: In 2022, the State recorded 5,315 probable and confirmed cases of leptospirosis and 290 deaths (both probable and confirmed). The very next year, 5,186 cases and 282 deaths were recorded. In 2024, the number of cases jumped to 5,980 and the deaths to  394. This year too, the picture looks quite alarming, with 1,451 cases and 74 deaths recorded till June 9.

title: Farmers pay tributes to those killed in 2008 Haveri police firing
content: They stage a demonstration at Hosamani Siddappa Circle in Haveri blocking the road for some time and raising various other demands

title: West Bengal Assembly unanimously passes resolution lauding armed forces
content: Mamata Banerjee says that during the conflict “there was an opportunity to capture Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir”;  Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari asks why reference to “Operation Sindoor” was absent in the Assembly resolution

title: New Osmania General Hospital scheduled to be ready in 30 months at estimated cost of ₹1,667 crore
content: The main hospital structure will rise to 12 floors, including two basement levels for parking, covering a total built-up area of 23.42 lakh square feet

title: Re-enumeration of castes: A setback for Siddaramaiah
content: The Chief Minister has been justifying the caste census report, insisting that it was scientifically done and that it would help assess the social, economic, and educational conditions of various communities

title: Young horticulture graduates told to update their skills
content: As many as 95 gold medals awarded to 35 students at 14th convocation of University of Horticultural Sciences in Bagalkot

title: Reduce fertilizer use to preserve soil health, says Naidu
content: CM directs officials to ensure that 35 lakh metric tons of fertilizer is used in the kharif season this year against 39 lakh metric tons used in the season last year

title: Pakistan in the grip of a ‘military-terrorist nexus’: Prasad
content: The BJP MP says the multi-party delegation he led to multiple European countries gave historical context to India’s Operation Sindoor

title: School headmaster suspended over participation of POCSO case accused in school Praveshanolsavam
content: Headmaster’s inattention had resulted in the participation of a POCSO case accused in the school Praveshanolsavam last week

title: TTD to conduct ‘Sadgamaya’ from June 16 to inculcate values among schoolchildren
content: Executive Officer J. Shyamala Rao says classes will be conducted for the seventh, eighth and ninth grade students of the various schools run by the TTD in Tirupati and Tirumala

title: Andhra Pradesh government will release a notification soon to fill 8,000 doctor posts, says Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav inaugurates Block Public Health Unit and a tehsildar office at Tadimarri in Sri Sathya Sai district

title: Internship Kerala 1.0 to connect 1 lakh FYUGP students with internship opportunities
content: The platform, envisaged to cater to 1 lakh students, is expected to offer a diverse range of opportunities, categorised into free internships, internships with a stipend and paid internships.

title: Arambai Tenggol lifts shutdown in Manipur, seeks its leader’s release
content: Armed Meitei group said it heeded public appeals to end the shutdown; Imphal Valley returning to normalcy on Tuesday after clashes between protestors and security personnel on Monday night

title: Task Force on child rights told to meet compulsorily once in three months
content: The Child Rights Protection Task Force, headed by tahsildars, has been asked to take necessary preventive steps for child rights protection

title: Caste census will benefit NDA, delimitation is a Constitutional right: Kushwaha
content: NDA ally says Centre will get credit for caste census, noting that Congress and its allies never conducted it when in power; opposes southern CMs calling for population increases due to upcoming delimitation

title: Nominations of Kamal Haasan, DMK and AIADMK candidates from T.N. declared valid for Rajya Sabha election
content: If there are no withdrawals of candidates till 3 p.m. on June 12, the six candidates would be declared winners.

title: Stalin flags “high” interest rates for development loans, hopes for World Bank support
content: Interest rates range between 6% and 7%, says the Chief Minister; he adds that he expects World Bank to back investments that fulfil the socio-economic requirements of the people by providing loans

title: AMRUT 2.0 drinking water project to be implemented in seven Yadgir towns
content: Hunsagi, Kakkera, Shahapur, Bheemarayanagudi, Yadgir, Gurmitkal and another town are selected and a grant of ₹340.92 crore is allocated

title: Maharashtra doctors’ association seeks PM’s intervention on suspension of CMO of Goa hospital
content: It wants strict guidelines and protocols to prevent public defamation or suspension of medical officers without due process and inquiry

title: Private school urged to pay medical expenses of ‘injured’ student
content: DSS says it will close the main door of Vidyaranya School in Yadgir if it fails to fulfill the demand of the boy’s father

title: Kerala shipwreck: NGT seeks Tamil Nadu government’s report on plastic nurdle spill as debris reaches Dhanushkodi
content: The government has been asked to file a detailed response outlining the immediate measures taken to manage the nurdle spill and prevent further ecological damage

title: TG power utilities join hands with SBI, launch ₹1 crore accident insurance cover for employees
content: Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka says the scheme will make power staff work harder with assurance to their families

title: 20-year-old arrested on charge of murdering a girl in Anantapur
content: Anantapur I Town Inspector suspended for laxity in investigating the case, says the SP adding that they will write to the government for attachment of the property of the accused

title: Committee seeking exclusive corporation for Dharwad plans black flag protest against Joshi
content: The Separate Corporation for Dharwad Agitation Committee has warned of intensifying its agitation if BJP leaders try to create hurdles

title: Beef being 'weaponised' against Hindus, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: He cited the instances of beef being purportedly left in various places after Eid last week, including in front of Cotton University in Guwahati

title: ONGC, GAIL told to fulfil their CSR mandate in Konaseema
content: ONGC and GAIL engage in oil and natural gas exploration but observe poor funding under the CSR mandate, these companies must fund all the projects proposed under the mandate, said the Collector during a meeting with public sector units

title: Official apathy behind stalled Kallakkuttykudy bridge project, says Idukki MP
content: The concrete bridge connecting the Kallakkuttykudy tribal settlement to the outside world was washed away by the devastating flood in August 2018

title: NDA government failed to ensure women’s safety in Andhra Pradesh, alleges YSRCP MLC
content: The brutal murder of Tanmayi, an Intermediate student in Anantapur, is a result of the negligence of the police and the State government, says Varudu Kalyani

title: ChatGPT faces global outage; India, U.S. most affected
content: According to the real-time monitoring platform Downdetector, user reports of ChatGPT outages surged rapidly around 3:00 p.m., with about 800 complaints logged in India alone

title: UAE firms ink MoUs for ₹2,125 cr projects in Telangana, to create 5,020 jobs
content: Industries Minister D.Sridhar Babu urges people not to pay heed to those spreading misinformation as in just 18 months, the State has attracted more than ₹3 lakh crore investments, at least 1 lakh youth secured jobs in private sector

title: Hebbal flyover misses another deadline, BDA fixes August 15 as the revised opening date for new ramp
content: The BDA officials said that while the erection of all the girders has been completed, the concretisation work is now underway.

title: Espionage case: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra moves court, seeks regular bail
content: Jyoti Malhotra moved a regular bail plea before Judicial Magistrate (First Class) Sunil Kumar through her lawyer Kumar Mukesh.

title: Puducherry artist recreates portrait of Tamilisai Moovar of Sirkazhi
content: After extensive research and careful reading of books on the Tamil Trinity, R. Rajarajan began working on the portrait on acrylic canvas in March

title: South Western Railway to upgrade tunnel radio for safer operations on Braganza Ghats, one of India’s toughest rail sections
content: At an estimated cost of ₹12.21 crore, the SWR will introduce world-class communication system in Castle Rock–Kulem section, projected to be completed by October 2025

title: Madras High Court orders inquiry into dispute over taking Perambalur village temple car to streets with Scheduled Caste residents
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs the Perambalur District Legal Services Authority chirperson to measure the size of the temple car and the width of the streets

title: Congress decides to re-enumerate caste data in Karnataka to address concerns
content: “The Congress party has suggested to the chief minister to do a re-enumeration process within a stipulated time, say 60-80 days” said AICC General Secretary

title: NaMo survey on Modi government's 11 years gets over five lakh responses in a day
content: The survey offers a platform for people to directly share their feedback and opinions with the government

title: Congress slams Modi Govt after World Bank said extreme poverty in India declined, says inconvenient data brushed aside
content: The Opposition party's assertion came after the World Bank said India's extreme poverty rate declined sharply to 5.3% over a decade from 27.1% in 2011-12

title: World Bank Group’s centre in Chennai stands for operational excellence and innovation, says MD Wencai Zhang
content: Mr. Zhang was in Chennai for the reopening of the World Bank’s modernised Global Business Centre in Taramani

title: Delhi High Court to hear plea over sexual crimes against animals in July
content: A bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela on May 28 posted the matter on July 16 to enable the petitioner to bring more facts on record

title: BJP chief B.Y. Vijayendra calls Bengaluru stampede deaths dark episode in history of Karnataka, urges CM, Deputy CM and HM to resign
content: BJP chief claims CM and government organised the programme without proper planning with the intention of gaining the goodwill of cricket fans, took unilateral decisions and forced police officers to follow them

title: India would strike deep into Pakistan if provoked by terror attacks, warns Jaishankar
content: The on-ground hostilities from the Indian and Pakistan sides that lasted for four days ended with an understanding of stopping the military actions following talks between the directors general of military operations of both sides on May 10

title: Once hailed as UPSC hero, IAS officer caught taking bribe, Rs 47L more found in raid
content: Debabrata Mohapatra is an Assistant Editor at The Times of India, Bhubaneswar. He had been writing for TOI from Puri since 2006 before joining the Bhubaneswar bureau in August 2010. He covers crime, law & order and Congress. title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Indiana Pacers 123-107 in game 2 . the Thunder moved from -325 to -550 to win the title while the Pacers dropped down from +260 to +400 . in the finals MVP race, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (-550) is still the favorite by a wide margin .
